page.title: 11E.ALLINGTON(SPECIAL SCHOOL)
page.content: St Thomas more's school was founded in 1947.The school lies within 30 acres of grounds and offers accademic and social education for 70 boys aged 7-16 years who are in need of a change of environment.The total number of people employed are 50. The head teacher leads a team of eight full time and several part time teachers who provide a full range of learning situations ranging from individual remedial tuition through small group study to CSE and 'O' level.The class sizes vary between 5 and 10 pupils.Boys with severe learning difficulties have daily sessions of individual tuition.They are also able to atten Kingsbridge Community College for specific courses.
